SummaryEnglish: Prince Alexander, son of King Philip, and heir to the Macedonian empire, must fend off political sabotuers, assassins, and the jealousy of his own father to ascend to the position of king. Once there, he begins his quest to conquer all nations and become known as the Great King, though an ancient prophecy fortells that he will be the destroyer of the world and forever remembered as the Devil King.
SummaryJapanese: 紀元前4世紀のマケドニアを舞台に、謎の魔術師集団・ピュタゴラス教団と、時の支配者フィリポスII世の王子アレクサンダーが、世界の命運を賭けた戦いを繰り広げる。史実に沿ったストーリーではあるが、衣装・建築物・兵器など当時のものとは懸け離れたデザインがされており、また内容もかなり脚色されている。

1.SummaryEnglish: Prince Alexander, son of King Philip, and heir to the Macedonian empire, must fend off political saboteurs, assassins, and the jealousy of his own father to ascend to the position of king. Once there, he begins his quest to conquer all nations and become known as the Great King, though an ancient prophecy foretells that he will be the destroyer of the world and forever remembered as the Devil King.
1.SummaryJapanese: 紀元前356年。小国マケドニアの王子アレクサンダーは17歳で初めて他国を倒して以来、狂気をもはらむ闘いの才能を発揮し、古代ギリシア世界の制圧にかかる。そんなおり彼は美しい娘と出会うが、宿敵ダリウス３世との対決の時も待ち受けていた。

1.TitleEnglish: Act I: A Prophecy Born This Day
1.SummaryEnglish: Alexander of Macedonia is born prince of a thriving empire but the people have little faith in his potential rule as he lags in preparing for his first battle. He seeks to improve his speed by taming a man-eating horse.

2.TitleEnglish: Act II: The Thunder of Battle
2.SummaryEnglish: Alexander more than proves himself in his first battle but his tactics and the respect he earns makes his father King Philip wary of what this means for his reign. Philip's advisor proposes that he divorce Alexander's mother and take a new wife and sire a new heir, ridding him of the worry of Alexander's threat to his reign.

3.TitleEnglish: Act III: A Failure of Diplomacy
3.SummaryEnglish: A new king of Persia has arisen; Darius I and a war between Persia and Macedonia brews as Greece entangles two countries. Alexander seeks to learn more about his potential enemy, embarking on a dangerous mission and sneaks into Persia

4.TitleEnglish: Act IV: Ascension to the Throne
4.SummaryEnglish: Alexander lives in exile after Philip casts him aside in favor of his newborn son. Olympias curses Erydace with nightmares and Philip plans to proclaim himself a god to his people but Alexander has other plans.
4.SummaryJapanese:
Act.8	魔都彷徨
	Act.9	アモンの神託
	Act.10	ガウガメラの死闘
	Act.11	ペルセポリス炎上
Act.5	狂える ソクラテス	Act.12	虐殺行
Act.6	サモトラケの魔女	Act.13	カタルシス
Act.7	ゴルディオンのくびき	-

5.SummaryEnglish: Alexander campaigns to wipe out those who oppose him which puts the people of Athens in a frenzy as they wager between fighting him or submitting to him. A wise hermit is consulted by both sides as to what they should do.
5.TitleJapanese: 狂える ソクラテス

6.SummaryEnglish: As Alexander prepares for war with Persia, the secrets of his parents betrothal and his birth begin to surface by those who serve him.

7.SummaryEnglish: Alexander arrives in Gordium and takes up the challenge of the "Gordian Knot" before the Persians Mount a surprise attack. Alexander presses his chance to face Darius in "A Battle of Kings." Meanwhile, Philotus battles nightmares of his death at the hands of Alexander.
7.TitleJapanese: ゴルディオンのくびき

8.TitleEnglish: Act VIII: Here Shall Stand Alexandria

9.TitleEnglish: Act IX: The Oracle of Ammon
